faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-residents require a Spanish tax identification number (NIF). Our team assists with all legal requirements and documentation. Many international residents successfully own property in la Nucia.

faqs.question: What amenities are near NADIA VILLAGE?

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property purchase costs in Spain typically include: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.8-1%), property registration (0.1-0.3%), and potential real estate agent fees (3-5%). We provide transparent cost estimates during the consultation process.

faqs.question: What are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Annual property taxes (IBI) in la Nucia average approximately 0.4-0.7% of property value. Non-resident owners may also incur wealth tax. Spain offers favorable tax treatment for property ownership compared to many European countries.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Purchasing property does not automatically grant visa status. However, property ownership demonstrates financial stability beneficial for certain visa applications. UK and EU citizens have specific residency options. Consult with immigration specialists regarding your individual circumstances.
